references.paper_title: Batch Normalization: Accelerating Deep Network Training by Reducing Internal Covariate Shift
references.reason: This paper introduces Batch Normalization, a technique used to improve the training of deep neural networks, which is relevant because the paper uses deep equilibrium models.

references.paper_title: Iterative procedures for nonlinear integral equations
references.reason: This paper presents the Anderson acceleration method, a technique used to speed up the convergence of iterative methods, which is directly relevant to the paper's use of deep equilibrium models.
This paper introduces deep equilibrium models (DEQs), the core methodology of the paper.
This paper introduces neural algorithmic reasoning (NAR), a framework that uses graph neural networks to execute algorithms, providing the primary context for the paper.
This paper introduces a benchmark dataset of algorithms used to evaluate the performance of NAR models, providing the primary dataset for the paper's experiments.
